snippet: Dr. Craig Spencer, who tested positive for Ebola after treating patients in Guinea, was released from Bellevue Hospital Center, and doctors said he posed no danger to the public.
abstract: Dr Craig Spencer, New York City's first Ebola patient, is released from Bellevue Hospital Center; Mayor Bill de Blasio and First Lady Chirlane McCray are first in long line of people to hug Spencer, demonstrating that he poses no threat to public health; it is not known whether experimental treatments made difference in Spencer's recovery.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and MARC SANTORA

lead_paragraph: Dr. Craig Spencer, who tested positive for Ebola after treating patients in Guinea, was released from Bellevue Hospital Center, and doctors said he posed no danger to the public.

headline.main: Plenty of Hugs as Craig Spencer, Recovered New York Ebola Patient, Goes Home
headline.print_headline: Hugs as Ebola Patient, Cured, Leaves Hospital
